entry.title: a16z Expands To London Citing Favorable Crypto Regulatory Environment
entry.summary:
Andreessen Horowitz, the name behind venture capitalist firm a16z, is going international with a new crypto office in London. The new move from the venture capital company adds to the number of crypto-related firms in the US looking for a favorable environment outside the country.
a16z Cites US Regulatory Unclarity As A Push For Its International Move
On June 11, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) announced that its first international office would kick off in London later this year.¬†
The founder and managing partner of a16z crypto, Chris Dixion, explained the importance of regulatory clarity in building decentralized blockchain startups. He stated that the US crypto regulatory pressure is part of the reasons for a16z expansion into the UK.¬†

entry.title: NFT Market Sees 20% Drop in Weekly Sales After a Few Weeks of Gains
entry.summary:
After several weeks of consecutive gains, sales of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) have slumped 20.44% this week compared to the previous week. According to seven-day statistics, NFT sales totaled $152.96 million last week, with $84 million in sales originating from the Ethereum blockchain.
This Week‚Äôs NFT Sales Follow Crypto Market‚Äôs Nosedive
Sales of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) have nosedived more than 20% over the past seven days compared to the previous week. The decline follows several consecutive weeks of gains, during which Bitcoin (BTC)-based NFTs gained significant prominence. In the last seven days, NFT sales totaled $152.96 million, and the number of NFT buyers decreased by 63.59%. Ethereum-based NFT sales accounted for $84 million, representing 54.91% of the market share among 21‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse Says Hinman Documents Are ‚ÄúWell Worth the Wait‚Äù
entry.summary:
In a new tweet, Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse claims that the highly anticipated ‚ÄúHinman documents‚Äù were ‚Äúwell worth the wait,‚Äù hinting at their potential significance in the ongoing legal battle between Ripple and the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
With the documents expected to be unsealed this week, here is a recap of what we‚Äôve been waiting on and why it‚Äôs such an important moment in the crypto market.
The Ripple Effect Of The Hinman Docs
Named after William Hinman, the former Director of the Division of Corporation Finance at the SEC, the ‚ÄúHinman documents‚Äù are speculated to provide insight into the SEC‚Äôs stance on cryptocurrency regulation. In 2018, Hinman made a groundbreaking statement, asserting that Bitcoin and Ethereum were not securities under US law due to‚Ä¶

entry.title: U.S. Court Dismisses BitGo‚Äôs Lawsuit Against Galaxy Digital
entry.summary: A U.S. court has dismissed the lawsuit filed by BitGo against Galaxy Digital in relation to a failed merger previously agreed to in 2021. In the company‚Äôs response to the terminated merger agreement, BitGo had alleged that Galaxy Digital failed to uphold their end of the bargain, saying the company ‚Äúintends to hold Galaxy Digital legally responsible for its improper decision to terminate the merger agreement,‚Äù with a lawyer representing the company adding that ‚ÄúEither Galaxy owes BitGo a $100 million termination fee as promised or it has been acting in bad faith and faces damages of that much or more.‚Äù At the time of termination, Galaxy Digital cited BitGo's failure to deliver audited financial statements for 2021 that complied with the requirements of the agreement. According to court documents released June 9, this was a ‚Äúvalid basis‚Äù for the decision to end the merger, and it effectively voided the termination fee. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre pleased with the court‚Äôs decision to dismiss BitGo‚Äôs claims,‚Äù A statement made by Galaxy Digital on Twitter read. ‚ÄúNow is the time for all of us to work together and focus on the task at hand: Upgrading the global financial system in a manner that promotes innovation and protects investors and consumers alike.‚Äù Just last week, it was announced that BitGo reached a preliminary agreement to acquire its primary U.S. competitor, Prime Trust. Although the details of that merger have not yet been made public, the industry had widely speculated in recent days that Prime Trust faced financial troubles. As such, the agreement has been seen as a relatively good thing, avoiding what many thought may be a coming failure of another large firm.

entry.title: Argentina‚Äôs Bitcoin Community Created The World‚Äôs Largest Human Bitcoin Logo
entry.summary:
Last Saturday, over 500 people gathered in the Argentine Polo Field to create the largest human ‚Çø in the world in celebration of the 10th anniversary of NGO Bitcoin Argentina. The event aimed to showcase the technology's ability to mobilize people in defense of monetary freedom, privacy, and other values of the cryptocurrency ecosystem. The human ‚Çø, sitting at a massive 40 meters, became the world's largest bitcoin symbol. Jimena Vallone, director of Bitcoin Argentina, expressed hopes that this would be the first of many attempts to break the record.
Photo credits: @BitcoinAR
The event was captured by drones, documenting the scale of the gathering both day and night. Attendees also enjoyed activities such as a Kahoot game, with winners receivin‚Ä¶

entry.title: Fire Gary Gensler: Lawmaker Takes Stand Against SEC Chairman‚Äôs Crypto Agenda
entry.summary:
Lawmakers in the United States are taking a stand against the recent crackdown on the crypto industry by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Congressman Warren Davidson has been particularly vocal in his criticism of SEC Chairman Gary Gensler and has called for his removal.
‚ÄúTime For Real Reform‚Äù, Good For Crypto?
In a recent statement, Congressman Davidson claimed that he believes the SEC‚Äôs actions against the crypto industry are unjust and that the U.S. capital markets must be protected from a ‚Äútyrannical‚Äù chairman. He has introduced the SEC Stabilization Act, which aims to restructure the agency and remove Gary Gensler as its chair.
The Act proposes replacing the current single-chairman leadership structure with a six-commissioner body to ensure a more balanced and div‚Ä¶

entry.title: Over 100 Physical Attacks Against Bitcoin Holders And Infrastructure Recorded Since 2014
entry.summary:
There have been at least 100 physical attacks against Bitcoin holders or infrastructure facilitating BTC transactions, a recent list documenting all recorded attacks on June 12¬†shows. The list records all known physical attacks on BTC holders or facilities, including crypto ATMs, as early as 2014.
Over 100 Recorded Physical Attacks Against Bitcoin Holders
The list published on GitHub, a public code repository, and¬†shared by Bitcoin supporter Jameson Lopp, the chief technical officer of Casa, shows that the first recorded attack on BTC was in 2014 when Hal Finney fell victim. Finney was one the first supporters of Bitcoin who was also in touch with Satoshi Nakamoto, the mysterious founder of the cryptocurrency.
According to circulated news on that day, Finney was ‚ÄúSWATed‚Äù after mont‚Ä¶

entry.title: Sturdy Finance Falls Victim to Exploit, Losing 442 ETH in Latest Defi Hack
entry.summary:
Decentralized finance (defi) platform Sturdy Finance was exploited on Sunday evening, losing 442 ether to an attacker. The team behind the project stated that it is aware of the reported exploit and paused markets at 10:19 p.m. ET.
442 Ethereum Worth Over $766K Siphoned From Sturdy Protocol
The defi community has experienced another hack, with the Sturdy Finance protocol suffering a loss of 442 ETH, equivalent to an estimated $766,900, according to a summary by Blocksec, a smart contract auditing security team. The issue was also discovered by the blockchain intelligence firm Peckshield at 9:28 p.m. ET.
Hi @SturdyFinance, you may want to take a look: https://t.co/XiJppu6Ww3
The issue seems to be related to the price manipulation
‚Äî PeckShield Inc. (@peckshield) June 12, 2023
‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Hashrate Continues To Hit New ATH Despite Uncertain Market
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows the 7-day Bitcoin mining hashrate has continued to hit new all-time highs despite the FUD going around in the market.
7-Day Bitcoin Mining Hashrate Has Reached A New All-Time High
According to data from the on-chain analytics firm Glassnode, the 7-day hashrate has now hit a new ATH of 381 EH/s. The ‚Äúmining hashrate‚Äù is an indicator that measures the total amount of computing power connected to the Bitcoin blockchain by the miners.
When the value of this metric rises, it means that the miners are bringing in more machines online on the network at the moment. Such a trend may be a sign that miners are currently finding it attractive to mine on the blockchain.
On the other hand, low values of the indicator imply some miners are possibly leaving the chain right now.‚Ä¶

entry.title: Binance Scandal Escalates As Former SEC Official Reveals Secret DOJ Indictment
entry.summary:
Former Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) official John Reed Stark has recently suggested that the US Department of Justice (DOJ) will likely file, or may have already filed under seal, a criminal indictment against cryptocurrency exchange Binance for alleged money laundering.¬†
Stark, who worked in the SEC Enforcement Division for nearly two decades and managed many joint prosecutions between the SEC and DOJ, stated that the recent complaints filed by the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) and the SEC against Binance contained allegations of fraud, deception, obstruction of justice, and money laundering that read more like criminal indictments than civil complaints.
Is A US DOJ Criminal Indictment Imminent?
Stark pointed out that the charges could be related to money l‚Ä¶

entry.title: Hacker Exploits Sturdy Finance, Drains $800,000 From The Lending Protocol
entry.summary:
DeFi lending protocol, Sturdy Finance has lost nearly $800,000 in ETH to an attack. The protocol confirmed the incident in a June 12 tweet after receiving an alert from blockchain security firm, PeckShield. According to the report, the hacker exploited a vulnerability in Sturdy Finance‚Äôs price oracle, gaining access to drain funds from the protocol‚Äôs liquidity pool.¬†
The DeFi protocol said it had suspended all market transactions while taking further actions to analyze the situation.
Hacker Moves 442 ETH Stolen From Sturdy Finance To Tornado Cash
According to security firm BlockSec, Sturdy Finance‚Äôs hacker leveraged read-only reentrancy on the protocol‚Äôs price Balancer to manipulate the BstETH-STABLE price.¬†As a result, the hacker carted away 442 ETH worth approximately $800,000 at t‚Ä¶

entry.title: Potential Venus Protocol Liquidation Raises Concerns in BNB Community
entry.summary:
Crypto market observers are currently focusing on the Venus Protocol this week as the protocol grapples with a possible liquidation of binance coin (BNB). The hacker who exploited the BNB blockchain managed to secure $150 million in stablecoins through the use of Venus. If the price of BNB slips to $220 per unit, the position will be liquidated.
Crypto Community Focuses on Venus Protocol‚Äôs Role in BNB Liquidation Risk
The cryptocurrency community has been engaged in discussions about the Venus Protocol, a decentralized finance (defi) application for lenders and borrowers. Last year, during the attack on the BNB blockchain, a hacker managed to acquire $150 million in stablecoins from the Venus Protocol, utilizing 900,000 BNB.
The position is currently still active, but it is at risk o‚Ä¶

Performance artist Foodmasku describes at this year's NFC Lisbon how that simple question spiraled into a minting collection after collection of his edible works.

entry.title: Arianee CEO Pegs Wine and Spirits as Next 'Exciting' Industry to Make Web3 Leap
entry.summary: CEO and co-founder of Arianee Pierre Nicolas Hurstel unpacks the wide spectrum of digital collectibles from 10,000 PFP collections to access passes for exclusive events. And with an unannounced big brand soon joining, Hurstel revealed at NFC Lisbon which kind of NFTs big brands are moving towards.

entry.title: Why 'Words With Friends' Creator Paul Bettner is 'Allergic' to Pay-to-Win NFTs
entry.summary: Words With Friends and Wildcard creator Paul Bettner tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his perspective on what to do when NFTs become in-game characters and assets.

entry.title: Twitch Co-Founder Justin Kan: 18 Months is 'Several Decades' in Crypto
entry.summary: Fractal and Twitch co-founder Justin Kan gives Decrypt's Kate Irwin an update on all things Fractal and his perspective on blockchain technology in gaming.

entry.title: Playing for Money in Web3 Games Not 'Durable,' Says Fractal's Justin Kan
entry.summary: Twitch and Fractal co-founder Justin Kan and Fractal co-founder Dan Borstelmann share their perspectives on Web3 gaming's changing landscape with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: From Cyber Cafe to Web3: How Everquest Dev Jeffrey Butler Got Into Game Development
entry.summary: Everquest developer turned Avalon Chief Product Officer Jeffrey Butler tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how he got into game development.

entry.title: The Machines Arena Game Preview: Is This the Next Overwatch?
entry.summary: Decrypt contributor Ryan S. Gladwin shares an inside look at The Machines Arena, an upcoming top-down 4v4 shooter from Directive Games that will offer NFTs minted on Ethereum sidechain network Ronin.

entry.title: You 'Have' to Be on Mobile: InfiniGods Cofounders on Gaming
entry.summary: InfiniGods developers Damon Gura and Owen O‚ÄôDonoghue share their stance on why mobile gaming is essential to Web3 adoption and general success in the video games industry.

entry.title: Crypto Chaos of 2022 'Didn't Damage Technology Underlying the Industry': X Ventures Co-Founder Matthias Reiser
entry.summary: Ahead of this month's Proof of Talk event in Paris on June 14 and June 15, X Ventures co-founder and the event's co-organizer Dr. Matthias Reiser said nothing's changed for those with a "long-term view" of the industry. Still, events like the collapse of Terra and FTX in 20222 have certainly damaged investors' trust in crypto.

entry.title: Tron's Justin Sun Thinks Hong Kong Will Be a Big Fiat Onramp for Crypto
entry.summary: Justin Sun, Tron founder and advisor to crypto exchange Huobi, talks to Decrypt's Liam Kelly and Stacy Elliott about the impact of Hong Kong allowing residents to trade crypto, complications of restricting access based on location, and how AI will change the industry.

entry.title: NVIDIA's AI Push Could Change Gaming Forever
entry.summary: Computer tech firm NVIDIA profited off the crypto mining industry. Now, it's looking to artificial intelligence‚Äîand its stock price is soaring.

entry.title: Why InfiniGods Laughs at 'AAA' Web3 Games
entry.summary: The InfiniGods founders share their approach to game development and offer a critique of games that call themselves "AAA."

entry.title: Make it Fast, Make it Friendly: Jerome de Tychey Unpacks Key Themes at This Year's EthCC
entry.summary: After six years running, EthCC is back, this time in Paris from July 17 to July 20. Decrypt sat down with the brains behind one of Ethereum‚Äôs longest-running events Jerome de Tychey to get an inside look into what‚Äôs on the agenda this year, several unannounced guests, and the rollout of at least one ‚Äúsecret‚Äù DeFi project.
